solution.text:
Given that:
Area of \(\Delta ABO\) = _{i}_ sq.units,
AO:OD = 1:2
i.e., \(AO\over OD\) = \(1\over 2\)
From the figure it can be seen that, \(\Delta ABO\) and \(\Delta DCO\) are similar triangles.
Therefore,
By Theorem 6.6, we have,
\(Area(\Delta ABO)\over Area(\Delta DCO)\) = \(AO^2\over DO^2\)
\(Area(\Delta ABO)\over Area(\Delta DCO)\) = \(({AO\over DO})^2\)
i.e., \(_{i}_\over Area(\Delta DCO)\) = \(({1\over 2})^2\)
i.e., \(_{i}_\over Area(\Delta DCO)\) = \(1\over 4\)
i.e., \(Area(\Delta DCO)\) = _{{4*i}}_

content.text: In the given figure, if area of \(\Delta ABO\) is _{i}_sq. units, and BC divides AD at O in 1:2 ratio.Find the area of \(\Delta DCO\)
